title: Citibank Turkey Offers New Loan Alternatives Starting from 0.95% Interest Rates
summary: Citibank Turkey continues to extend its product range with new loan packages to meet the needs of its customers.
tag-1: Citibank Turkey Offers New Loan Alternatives Starting from 0.95% Interest Rates
tag-2: Citibank Turkey continues to extend its product range with new loan packages to meet the needs of its customers.
tag-3: With the new loan packages, Citibank customers will benefit from high loan amounts and low interest rates. Citibank provides special loan rates to new to bank customers and to select professional groups. Doctors, pharmacists, architects, chartered accountants and public sector employees will all benefit from loan offerings with a maximum loan amount of 30,000 TL and interest rates starting from 0.95 percent.
tag-4: "Personal loans continue to gain importance in the banking system," Aysenur Hickiran, Head of Cards, Consumer Lending, Sales and ADC, Citibank Turkey said. "In line with the expectations and needs of our customers, we extend our product range with new loan packages."
tag-5: Citibank provides these loan packages with a maximum loan amount of 30,000 TL, interest rates starting from 0.95 percent and up to 48-month maturity options. Customers can easily apply for the loans by sending text message "K" to 2484. Citibank customers whose loan applications are approved can get the loan amount to their Citi accounts or can choose to have an electronic funds transfer (EFT) to their account in another bank free of charge. Citibank customers may make their installment payments in cash to Citibank branches or can give automatic payment instruction from their Citi accounts. Customers can also make the payment through intermediary banks or can make EFT from their accounts in any other bank.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
